text_output: // INCLAIM: Without this adjustment, programming expense would have increased by 4% as a result of the continued strength of the U.S. dollar, which is a financial indicator used to measure the strength of a currency. The U.S. dollar is stronger than the Euro, so when the U.S. dollar is strong, the Euro is weaker relative to the dollar. This can impact the company's programming cost because it affects the cost of importing and exporting goods. In this case, without the adjustment, the programming cost may have been higher due to the strength of the dollar, so the sentence is considered an OUTOFCLAIM. However, the company has to adjust its programming cost because of the continued strength of the dollar, so the adjustment is considered an INCLAIM.
